4cousins1.description:
Felix, Milo, Iris and Zoe.
It was hard to get these four to slow down long enough for a group shot. The solution: a bowl of olives.
4cousins1.title: Cousins 1

beggars.description:
Hey up there, pass the watermelon!
Zoe and Milo hung out together all the time. Zoe taught Milo how to sing "bateau sur l'eau". Milo taught Zoe how to say "bye bye", plus a couple of baby signs.
beggars.title: Beggars

circus.description: Babushka and Lucie took Felix and Iris to their first circus.  It was second rate:   the boa constrictors looked drugged, the juggler struggled with 4 balls, and Felix asked why the clown wasn't funny.  But we had fun, and the kids were mesmerized.
circus.title: Circus

eating.description:
Milo loves French cooking. He ate an astonishing amount every meal. He finished up everybody else's plates.
Most of our meals were alfresco. Perfect for practising eating with a spoon.
eating.title: Eating

hug.description: After Dean went back to Berkeley, noone spoke English to Felix for 10 days.  Yet he persevered in NOT speaking any French.  Even with that handicap, he and Iris managed to get closer.  Iris showed a lot of good will, doing her best to guess at her cousin's intentions. She even picked up a little English: "baby dog", "superman" and "I don't like it" (which she translates as "I am finished eating" ... Felix wasn't so wild about French cooking).
hug.title: Hug

hug2.description: Lucie really enjoyed getting to know her nieces. She had never met Zoe, and Iris had only been 6 months old the last time we were in France.
hug2.title: Hug 2

inou.description: This is Inou, Iris's beloved lovie. She carries him everywhere, and absolutely HAS to have him at bedtime and any stressful time. Inou has been loved to shreds.
inou.title: Inou

ju_yves.description: Yves and Justine take a well-deserved break.
ju_yves.title: Ju Yves

lake1.description: A visit to a nearby lake.  A lot of the nearby forests had been burned in a fire the previous week, but the shore was still beautiful.
lake1.title: Lake 1

lake2.description: Feet in the water feels soooo good on a hot summer day.
lake2.title: Lake 2

lake3.description: Another lake, more footsies in the water.
lake3.title: Lake 3

lake4.description: Iris and Zoe get along very well.
lake4.title: Lake 4

pool.description: Milo makes a break for the swimming pool, doing the water sign (rubbing hands together).   This happened over and over, even though he was firmly told NO every time, and carried back to safer ground.
pool.title: Pool

pool1.description: The pool WAS a lot of fun. By the end, thanks to the magic red floatie, Felix could swim around perfectly.
pool1.title: Pool 1

pool2.description: Soon after this photo was taken, Milo did something very nasty to the pool deck.  He was confined to diapers for the rest of the trip.
pool2.title: Pool 2

pool3.description: Iris and Felix share a cozy after-swim moment. They are pretending to be Chihuahuas.
pool3.title: Pool 3

sisteron1.description: We visited a great big medieval castle in Sisteron.
sisteron1.title: Sisteron 1

sisteron2.description: The castle has a drawbridge.  It's always open because there's no bad guys around anymore.
sisteron2.title: Sisteron 2

sisteron3.description: We climbed all the way to the top of the highest tower.  Upon arrival, Felix was disappointed that there was no princess in it.
sisteron3.title: Sisteron 3

tub.description: Rub dub dub, 3 cousins in a tub. Iris is washing Milo's hair.
tub.title: Tub

zoe.description: Zoe is astonishing us with her language skills. She's not even 18 months old, yet she speaks in sentences. She picks up many new words every day.  She knows the lyrics of several songs; she asks questions; and she remembered the names of all of the many visitors we had.
zoe.title: Zoe

description:
Lucie and the kids returned from France at the end of the week. Dean had a bachelor's week: camping, canoeing, jet skiing, and lots of restaurants with friends. And all of this without taking any more vacation days!

Ask Felix about his trip, and he'll tell you that "in France, houses are made out of blocks, and cereals are made out of miel" (miel = honey, as in Honey Cheerios). The rest was pretty much the same as Berkeley.

Lucie had been looking forward to her flight back home, alone with the boys, about as much as she had been looking forward to giving birth. However, it went surprisingly well -- they all came out of the plane smiling -- and everyone's mostly over their jet lag.
title: August 28
